channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Upwork CEO Hayden Brown: ‘There will be plenty of work for humans, even as AI agents do more’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Surprise in Japan’s leadership race jolts financial markets as the dollar soars against the yen
item.description: Takaichi favors looser fiscal and monetary policies, raising expectations that Tokyo will issue more debt while the central bank rethinks rate hikes.

item.title: What happens when C-suite pay becomes all or nothing
item.description: Inside the new era of high-stakes compensation that rewards only those who deliver outsize success.

item.title: More lawmakers say they're rejecting paychecks as government shutdown drags on
item.description: Lawmakers from both parties are asking to have their pay withheld as the government shutdown nears a week.

item.title: When Students Refuse to Be Friends, Our Republic Is at Risk
item.description: If we want to strengthen civic knowledge and civic trust in America, we must focus on the people who will teach these lessons every day.

item.title: Shutdown set to drag into sixth day with no signs of a breakthrough in Congress
item.description: The government shutdown enters its sixth day on Monday with lawmakers still stuck in their partisan corners and no prospect of a swift resolution.

item.title: What the Meltdown over Hegseth’s All-Hands Military Speech Tells Us About Modern Media
item.description: Resistance Twitter can make any news event sound like the end of the world.

item.title: Trump promises pay raises for military coming, despite government shutdown

item.title: The Jay Jones Misdirection
item.description: The Democratic candidate for attorney general in Virginia took aim at National Review for exposing his violent fantasies.

item.title: Climate Policy: EAT Your Greens
item.description: The week of September 29, 2025: The war on meat (and much, much more) continues, the debt, taxation, and, yes, much, much, more.

item.title: In heavyweight movie showdown, Taylor Swift’s ‘Show Girl’ smashes The Rock’s ‘Smashing Machine’
item.description: “The Official Release Party of a Show Girl” debuted at No. 1 with $33 million in North America, according to Sunday estimates from Comscore.

item.title: Trump warns of 'massive bloodshed' if Hamas fails to agree to peace deal: 'MOVE FAST'
item.description: President Donald Trump posted on social media minutes before a Hamas peace proposal deadline, warning of massive bloodshed if talks fail.

item.title: DOJ Opens Investigation Into Antifa-Indulging Portland Police
